Heading.name: Allows for rapid iteration and prototyping
Heading.Info: Refresh the page and see changes without redeploying
Auto-compilation: one less thing to remember/worry about
Activator includes local test server for easy-to-see results

Heading.name: Supports Java
Heading.Info: Mature language with flushed out libraries
Wide IDE and tool support (e.g. built-in IDE, Eclipse)
Compiled files are interoperable between OS, provided JRE exists.
Large support and user base on StackOverflow

Heading.name: Also supports Scala
Heading.Info: Concurrency is easy: Minimize side effects, immutable and persistent data structures, Avoids mutable state, First class functions

Heading.name: Free, open source, and extensible
Heading.Info: Uses Apache license, as mentioned earlier Available on GitHub (https://github.com/playframework/playframework) Can add plugins or modules that extend functionality for security, databases, front-end, etc.

Heading.name: Well supported
Heading.Info: Typesafe provides commercial backing/support for Play
Also has active community and support base on StackOverflow
Plenty of documentation around: tutorials, website, Play APIs, YouTube, etc.
